text.p: Write a Python function, twoQuadratics, that takes in two sets of coefficients and x-values and prints the sum of the results of evaluating two quadratic equations. It does not do anything else. That is, you should evaluate and print the result of the following equation: [mathjaxinline]a_1*x_1^2 + b_1*x_1 + c_1 + a_2*x_2^2 + b_2*x_2 + c_2[/mathjaxinline]
You are given the following function, evalQuadratic
text.pre: def evalQuadratic(a, b, c, x): ''' a, b, c: numerical values for the coefficients of a quadratic equation x: numerical value at which to evaluate the quadratic. ''' return a*x*x + b*x + c
